PREFERREDLABEL: helping adults who need care or are sick
ALTLABELS:
helping adults who need care or are sick
affective/emotional support for dependent adults
emotional care for dependent adults
supporting the emotional well-being of dependent adults
providing companionship to dependent adults
assisting dependent adults with forms, administration, accounts
assisting dependent adults with financial matters and administration
assisting dependent adults with finances and paperwork
managing paperwork for dependent adults
helping dependent adults manage their affairs
assisting dependent adults with medical care
supporting dependent adults in healthcare
supporting dependent adults with medical needs
assisting dependent adults with tasks of daily living
supporting dependent adults with daily activities
meetings and arrangements with adult care service providers
scheduling and coordinating care services for dependent adults
passive care of dependent adults
monitoring dependent adults
providing passive supervision for dependent adultsniors
DESCRIPTION:
Refers to the assistance and care provided to dependent adults.
Dependent adults refers to persons suffering any physical or mental illness or any disability or impairment who require assistance or help from other person to undertake daily activities including older persons.
This does not include adults who require temporary assistance.

Examples:
- Cheered up my grandmother
- Completed insurance claim for my grandfather
- Collected pension for my father
- Paid taxes for my father
- Feeding elderly grandfather
- Assisted with showering dependent adult
- Made bed and cleaned room for dependent adult
- Met with dad's carer
- Supervised my dad
- Talking and listening to dependent adults
- Completing documents for the dependent adult
- Reading forms to the dependent adult
- Giving personal care to adults
- Feeding, washing, dressing, preparing them for bed
- Calls to institutions
- Visit institutions
- Meeting carers
- Monitoring dependent adults while undertaking activities or sleeping, preserving a safe environment
- Being a presence to turn to in need
- Supervising activities
SCOPENOTE:
Includes:
- [Assisting dependent adults with tasks of daily living](urn:icatus:2016:421)
- [Assisting dependent adults with medical care](urn:icatus:2016:422)
- [Assisting dependent adults with forms, administration, accounts](urn:icatus:2016:423)
- [Affective/emotional support for dependent adults](urn:icatus:2016:424)
- [Passive care of dependent adult](urn:icatus:2016:425)
- [Meetings and arrangements with adult care service providers](urn:icatus:2016:426)
Excludes:
- [Other activities related to care for dependent adults](urn:icatus:2016:429)

- [Travelling and accompanying goods or persons related to unpaid caregiving services for household and family members](urn:icatus:2016:44)
- [Other activities related to unpaid caregiving services for household and family members](urn:icatus:2016:49)

PREFERREDLABEL: helping with sports, music or other cultural activities without getting paid
ALTLABELS:
helping with sports, music or other cultural activities without getting paid
unpaid volunteer cultural activities recreation and sports activities
unpaid volunteer work in sports and cultural activities
community-based cultural and sports unpaid volunteering
DESCRIPTION:
Refers to unpaid, non-compulsory activities to work in cultural activities, recreation and sports activities as help, arranged by the community or an organization.

Examples:
- Coached my kid's soccer team
- Volunteered to assist runners after marathon (unpaid)
- Performed dance at a public festival (not for pay or profit)
- Played an instrument in an orchestra/classical music programme (not for pay or profit)
SCOPENOTE:
Includes unpaid volunteer activities such as:
- Coaching, refereeing etc. in sports and gymnastics as help
- Leading youth group, for example, scout or boy/girl guide leader as help
- Volunteer participation in cultural activities such as theatrical performance as help

PREFERREDLABEL: helping with office work without getting paid
ALTLABELS:
helping with office work without getting paid
unpaid volunteer office/administrative work
community office/administrative work
providing unpaid volunteer help to non-profits
unpaid volunteer office support work
DESCRIPTION:
Refers to unpaid, non-compulsory activities to undertake office/administrative work as help, arranged by the community or an organization.

Examples:
- Volunteered at the church office (unpaid)
SCOPENOTE:
Includes unpaid volunteer activities such as:
- Preparing correspondence, assistance repairs and other odd jobs for the organization as help
- Giving information, distributing leaflets as help
- Work as committee member, fund-raising activities as help
- Participation in civic, professional, fraternal, political etc. organizations as help

PREFERREDLABEL: cooking or cleaning for other people's homes without getting paid
ALTLABELS:
cooking or cleaning for other people's homes without getting paid
unpaid volunteer preparing/serving meals, cleaning up
community meal preparation, service and cleaning up support
unpaid meal preparation and service
unpaid volunteer food and cleanup activities
DESCRIPTION:
Refers to unpaid, non-compulsory activities to preparing/serving meals, cleaning up as help, arranged by the community or an organization.

Examples:
- Prepared food for community festival (as an unpaid volunteer)
- Cleaned up after school potluck (as an unpaid volunteer)
- Served dinner at a homeless shelter (as an unpaid volunteer)
- Prepared cake for school bake sale (as an unpaid volunteer)
- Assist with cooking at a funeral (as an unpaid volunteer)
SCOPENOTE:
Includes unpaid volunteer activities such as:
- Organizing, planning and preparing meals/snacks as help
- Serving meals/snacks as help
- Cleaning up after food preparation/meals/snacks as help

PREFERREDLABEL: cleaning or fixing roads or buildings without getting paid
ALTLABELS:
cleaning or fixing roads or buildings without getting paid
unpaid volunteer work on road/building repair, clearing and preparing land, cleaning (streets, markets, etc.), and construction

Refers to unpaid, non-compulsory activities to work on road/building repair, clearing and preparing land, cleaning (streets, markets, etc.), and construction as help, arranged by the community or an organization.

Examples:

unpaid volunteer care for adults

DESCRIPTION:
Refers to unpaid, non-compulsory activities to take care of adults as help to other households, not arranged by an organization.

Examples:
- Cooked food to my sick neighbour
SCOPENOTE:
Includes unpaid volunteer activities such as:
- Assisting adults with tasks of daily living as help
- Assisting adults with medical care as help
- Assisting adults with forms, administration, accounts as help
- Affective/emotional support for adults as help
- Passive care as help

PREFERREDLABEL: caring for and teaching for children outside of your home without getting paid
ALTLABELS:
caring for and teaching for children outside of your home without getting paid
unpaid volunteer childcare and instruction
unpaid volunteer childcare and teaching
community childcare and instruction
babysitting and child supervision
DESCRIPTION:
Refers to unpaid, non-compulsory activities to take care and instruct children as help to other households, not arranged by an organization.

Examples:
- Took care of neighbour's child
SCOPENOTE:
Includes unpaid volunteer activities such as:
- Caring for children including feeding, cleaning, physical care as help
- Providing health/medical care to children as help
- Instructing, teaching, training, helping children as help
- Talking with and reading to children (including emotional support) as help
- Playing and sports with children as help
- Minding children (passive care) as help

PREFERREDLABEL: fixing and building things in other people's homes without getting paid
ALTLABELS:
fixing and building things in other people's homes without getting paid
unpaid volunteer household maintenance, management, construction, renovation and repair
household volunteering
housekeeping volunteering
unpaid home repair and management
community household assistance
DESCRIPTION:
Refers to unpaid, non-compulsory activities to provide household maintenance, management, construction, renovation and repair as help to other households, not arranged by an organization.

Examples:
- Cleaned neighbour's house
- Helping with neighbour's garden
- Walking neighbour's dog
SCOPENOTE:
Includes unpaid volunteer activities such as:
- Preparing and serving meals as help to other households
- Cleaning and upkeep as help to other households
- Care of textiles as help to other households
- Household management as help to other households
- Pet care as help to other households
- Other specified help to other households
- Construction, renovation and repairs of dwellings and other structures as help to other households

PREFERREDLABEL: shopping for others without getting paid
ALTLABELS:
shopping for others without getting paid
unpaid volunteer shopping/purchasing goods and services
assisting with shopping and errands
DESCRIPTION:
Refers to unpaid, non-compulsory activities to shop/purchase goods and services as help to other households, not arranged by an organization.

Examples:
- Shopped (including online) groceries for neighbour
SCOPENOTE:
Includes unpaid volunteer activities such as:
- Shopping for/purchasing of goods as help
- Shopping for/purchasing of services as help
- Other specified shopping/purchasing as help

Excludes:
- [Shopping for/purchasing of goods and related activities](urn:icatus:2016:371)
- [Shopping for/availing of services and related activity](urn:icatus:2016:372)

PREFERREDLABEL: helping in other people's businesses without getting paid
ALTLABELS:
helping in other people's businesses without getting paid
unpaid volunteer unpaid help in enterprises owned by other households
unpaid assistance in household enterprises
DESCRIPTION:
Refers to unpaid, non-compulsory activities to help in enterprises owned by other households as help to other households, not arranged by an organization.

Examples:
- Help my neighbour in his business
SCOPENOTE:
Includes unpaid volunteer activities such as:
- Production of goods as help
- Provision of services as help
- Purchasing inputs as help
- Disposing or selling outputs as help
